page.title: 18Farming in Collingham
page.content: Living in Collingham was once very dependent on farming.Many of the village people were employed on farms, successive generations of families earning a living from the land.Today this is just not so.Many of the farms have now either been given over to housing development or have merged with others to make larger units.There is not the mixed farming there once was.At the moment{oil seed rape }is very much the crop in demand.Also the close proximity of the sugar factory has encouraged farmers to plant{sugar {beet. } With the advent of larger and more modern machinery,less people are needed to work the land.Hedges are taken up to make farming easier and more profitable.This,of course,has its effect on the{wild life and general {ecology }of the area.
